intro: Borbonia latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf borbonia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
